Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.custom_middleware(request: Request, call_next)¶

The custom_middleware function is a middleware function that adds the time it took to process the request in seconds as a header called ‘performance’

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Get the request object

  • call_next – Call the next middleware in the chain

Returns:

A middleware function

Doc-author:

Trelent

main.healthchecker(db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a simple function that checks the health of the database. It does this by making a request to the database and checking if it returns any results. If there are no results, then we know something is wrong with our connection.

Parameters:

db – Session: Get the database connection from the dependency

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.root()¶

The root function is a simple function that returns a welcome message. It’s purpose is to show the user how to use the API and what it can do.

Returns:

A dictionary with a key &quot;message&quot; and value &quot;welcome to restapi&quot;

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are needed by your app, like connecting to databases or initializing external APIs.

Returns:

The FastAPILimiter object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactResponse, db: Session)¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database. Args:

body (ContactResponse): The contact to be created.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactResponse: Create a new contact object

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact that was created

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_birthdays_one_week(db: Session)¶

The get_birthdays_one_week function returns a list of contacts whose birthdays are within the next week.

Parameters:

db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of BirthdayResponse objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, db: Session)¶

The get_contact_by_id function returns a contact object from the database based on its id. Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the desired contact. db (Session): A connection to the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be returned

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: Session)¶
The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts from the database.
Args:

limit (int): The number of contacts to return. offset (int): The number of contacts to skip before returning results.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Skip the first n number of contacts

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session)¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. db (Session): A connection to the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be removed

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session object

Returns:

The contact that was deleted

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(query: str, db: Session)¶

The search_contacts function searches the database for contacts that match a given query.

Parameters:

  • query – str: Search the database for a contact

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactResponse, contact_id: int, db: Session)¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

body (ContactResponse): The updated contact information. contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactResponse: Get the data from the request body

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be updated

  • db – Session: Connect to the database

Returns:

The contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user who is trying to confirm their account

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Pass in the UserModel object that is created from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object, which is the same as what we return from our get_user function

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user with that email if it exists. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass in the email of the user we want to find

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object or none if the user is not found

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Pass in the url of the avatar that we want to update

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, refresh_token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Pass the user object to the function

  • refresh_token – str | None: Pass the refresh token to the update_token function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

Nothing

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactResponse, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → ContactResponse¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactResponse: Pass the data from the request body to the function

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A ContactResponse object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → ContactResponse¶

The get_contact function is a GET request that returns the contact with the given ID. If no contact exists with that ID, it will return a 404 Not Found error.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the path

  • db – Session: Get a database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A ContactResponse object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_birthday(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contacts_birthday function returns a list of contacts that have birthdays within the next week.

The function takes in a database session and current user as parameters, which are used to query the database for contacts with birthdays within one week. The function then returns those contacts.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Get access to the database

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts with birthdays in the next week

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.read_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = 0, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → List[ContactResponse]¶

The read_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Specify the maximum number of contacts that can be returned

  • le – Limit the maximum value of the parameter

  • offset – int: Specify the number of contacts to skip

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.

The function takes in an integer representing the id of the contact to be removed, and returns a dictionary containing information about that contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Get a database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

The removed contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.search_contacts(query: str = Query(), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The search_contacts function searches for contacts in the database.

Parameters:

  • query – str: Pass the search query to the function

  • min_length – Ensure that the query string is not empty

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the user from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts, which is the same as the return type for get_contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactResponse, contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → ContactResponse¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes an id and a body as input, and returns the updated contact. If no such contact exists, it raises an HTTPException with status code 404.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactResponse: Pass the contact information to be updated

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Check if the user is logged in

Returns:

A ContactResponse object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The read_users_me function is a GET request that returns the current user’s information.

It requires authentication, and it uses the auth_service to get the current user.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Get the current user object

Returns:

The current user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

The update_avatar_user function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Receive the file from the client

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The updated user

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address. It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. The function then checks if there is a user with that email in our database, and if not, returns an error message. If there is a user with that email in our database,

we check whether their account has already been confirmed or not.

If it has been confirmed already, we return another error message saying so; otherwise we call repository_users’ confirmed_email function which sets the ‘confirmed’ field of that particular User object

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the email from the token

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message that the email is already confirmed or a message that the email has been confirmed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes the username and password from the request body, verifies them against the database, and returns an access token if successful.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass a database session to the function

Returns:

A dict with the access_token and refresh_token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token. If the user’s current refresh_token does not match what was

passed into this function then it will return an error.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A new access_token and refresh_token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that will allow them to confirm their account. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the email of the user who wants to confirm their account. It then checks if there is already an unconfirmed account associated with that email address, and if so it sends an email containing a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the server

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A message to the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserModel object as input, which is validated by pydantic. The password is hashed using bcrypt and stored in the database. A background task sends an email to the user with their username.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Pass the data from the request body to the function

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

The created user

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token for the user.

The function takes in two arguments: data and expires_delta. Data is a dictionary that contains all of the information about the user, such as their username, email address, etc. Expires_delta is an optional argument that specifies how long you want your access token to be valid for (in seconds). If no value is specified then it defaults to 48 hours.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data to be encoded

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time for a token

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the data, current time, expiry time and scope

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is encoded with the SECRET_KEY, which is stored in the .env file. The algorithm used to encode the token is also stored in the .env file.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the token

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the user’s email and a secret key

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the token expires, defaults to None.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

An encoded refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It takes a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if it’s valid. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail ‘Could not validate credentials’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user that is associated with the refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user if it’s valid, or raises an exception otherwise.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes

  • token – str: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object if the token is valid

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email associated with that token. It does this by decoding the JWT using our SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM, then checking to make sure that it has a scope of ‘email_token’. If so, it returns the email address from the payload’s sub field. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (Unauthorized) and detail message &quot;Invalid scope for token&quot;. If there is any other error in decoding or validating the JWT, we raise another HTTPException with status code 422 :param self: Represent the instance of the class :param token: str: Pass in the token that is sent to the user’s email :return: The email address associated with the token :doc-author: Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object, which is an instance of Flask-Bcrypt’s Bcrypt class.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Specify the password that will be hashed

Returns:

A hash of the password

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Check if the password is correct

  • hashed_password – Compare the password that is being entered to the hashed password in the database

Returns:

A boolean value, true or false

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.
The function takes in three parameters:

-email: EmailStr, the user’s email address that they entered when signing up for an account. -username: str, the username of the user who is trying to sign up for an account. This will be used in

conjunction with host (see below) and token_verification (see below) as part of a URL that will be sent via email to verify their identity and allow them access into our system.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address to send the message to

  • username – str: Pass the username to the email template

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to the template

Returns:

A coroutine object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Cloud Image¶

class src.services.cloud_image.CloudImage¶

Bases: object

static generate_name_avatar(email: str)¶

The generate_name_avatar function takes an email address as input and returns a unique avatar name. The function uses the first 12 characters of the SHA256 hash of the email address to generate a unique string. This string is then appended with &quot;web9/&quot; to create a valid S3 bucket key.

Parameters:

email – str: Specify the type of parameter that is expected to be passed into the function

Returns:

A string that is a combination of the prefix &quot;web9/&quot;

and a 12-character hash of the email address :doc-author: Trelent

static get_url_for_avatar(public_id, r)¶

The get_url_for_avatar function takes in a public_id and an r (which is the result of a cloudinary.api.resource call) and returns the URL for that avatar image, which will be used to display it on the page.

Parameters:

  • public_id – Identify the image in cloudinary

  • r – Get the version of the image

Returns:

A url

Doc-author:

Trelent

static upload(file, public_id: str)¶

The upload function takes a file and public_id as arguments. The function then uploads the file to Cloudinary using the public_id provided. If no public_id is provided, one will be generated automatically.

Parameters:

  • file – Specify the file to be uploaded

  • public_id – str: Set the public id of the image

Returns:

A dictionary with the following keys:

Doc-author:

Trelent
